summary: This bill, known as the "Denying Regulatory Interference with Landowners and Legislatures Now Act" (DRILL Now Act), amends the Water Resources Development Act of 2007. It prohibits the Susquehanna River Basin Commission, the Delaware River Basin Commission, and the Interstate Commission on the Potomac River Basin from implementing or enforcing regulations on hydraulic fracturing (fracking) within their respective basins unless the regulation originates from the state where it would be enforced. The bill aims to limit federal and interstate commission oversight of fracking.
